text:
I am trying to plot something which has a vector of `NaN`s. Before it used to ignore it, but it gives me an error. It is julia plots. Any idea guys?
I also *didnt* update any of the packages
Here is the picture of my screen with the error

text: It is better to paste code instead of an image. But it looks like one of your arrays is empty. Could that be the case?

text: Previously, Plots would read an array with NaN, now it throws me this error.

elements.text: Previously, Plots would read an array with NaN, now it throws me this error.

text:
Why are you certain that the NaN are the problem? Could you pase a minimal example to help us reproduce your issue?
This works for me, doesn’t it work for you?:
```julia> using Plots; gr()
julia> x = collect(1:3)
julia> one_nan = [1.0, NaN, 2.0]
julia> all_nan = [NaN, NaN, NaN]
julia> p1 = plot(x, all_nan)
julia> p2 = plot(x, all_nan)
julia> plot(p1, p2, layout=(1,2))```

elements.text:
Why are you certain that the NaN are the problem? Could you pase a minimal example to help us reproduce your issue?
This works for me, doesn’t it work for you?:

julia> using Plots; gr()
julia> x = collect(1:3)
julia> one_nan = [1.0, NaN, 2.0]
julia> all_nan = [NaN, NaN, NaN]
julia> p1 = plot(x, all_nan)
julia> p2 = plot(x, all_nan)
julia> plot(p1, p2, layout=(1,2))
a = rand(10)

text: sorry.... new to slack. but yes, you have the analogous problem. Indeed, this used to work for me but for some reason it no longer does. I've tried building Plots and GR again to no avail

elements.text: sorry.... new to slack. but yes, you have the analogous problem. Indeed, this used to work for me but for some reason it no longer does. I've tried building Plots and GR again to no avail

text:
```julia> using Plots; gr()
julia> x = collect(1:3)
julia> one_nan = [1.0, 2.0, 3.0]
julia> all_nan = [6.0, 5.0, 4.0]
julia> p1 = plot(x, all_nan)
julia> p2 = plot(x, all_nan)
julia> plot(p1, p2, layout=(1,2))```
This works? Did you restart julia after doing building Plots and GR?

elements.text:
julia> using Plots; gr()
julia> x = collect(1:3)
julia> one_nan = [1.0, 2.0, 3.0]
julia> all_nan = [6.0, 5.0, 4.0]
julia> p1 = plot(x, all_nan)
julia> p2 = plot(x, all_nan)
julia> plot(p1, p2, layout=(1,2))
This works? Did you restart julia after doing building Plots and GR?

text: You can add a previous version (do `] add Plots@1.10.6` for example and then restart Julia and try again) for the time being and It would be nice if you could open an issue in <https://github.com/JuliaPlots/Plots.jl> (If you cannot I can do it for you)
